htw.vs1.filesystem.FileSystem.virtual

Interface FileSystemInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    FileSystem

    public interface FileSystemInterface

    The FileSystemInterface declares the interface to work on our filesystem.

    To modify the content of the current working directory use getWorkingDirectory() and operate on the Folder-Object itself.

    Created by felix on 03.06.15.

    • Method Detail

      • setWorkingDirectory

        void setWorkingDirectory(@NotNull
                         Folder workingFolder)
                  throws FileSystemException
        Sets the given Folder as the working directory.
        Parameters:
        workingFolder - new working directory.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException

      • getWorkingDirectory

        Folder getWorkingDirectory()
        Gets the current working directory.
        Returns:
        the current working directory.

      • changeDirectory

        void changeDirectory(@NotNull
                     java.lang.String path)
              throws FileSystemException

        Changes the current working directory to the Folder under the given path.

        Parameters:
        path - path to the Folder. This can be either a relative path, an absolute path or simple the name of a Folder in the current working directory.
        Throws:
        ObjectNotFoundException - if the object identified by the given name is not available.
        FileSystemException

      • listDirectoryContent

        java.util.List<FSObject> listDirectoryContent()
                                       throws FileSystemException

        Returns the content of the current directory as a List of FSObject's.

        Returns:
        content of the current directory.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException

      • printWorkingDirectory

        java.lang.String printWorkingDirectory()

        Prints the current working directory in a String.

        Example: /usr/root/home
        Returns:
        current working directory as String.

      • search

        java.util.List<FSObject> search(java.lang.String name)
                         throws FileSystemException
        Search recursively through the current working directory all FSObject with the given name.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the FSObject to search for.
        Returns:
        a List of FSObjects matching to the given name.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException

      • createFSObject

                    boolean isFolder)
             throws FileSystemException
        Creates a new FSObject and adds it to the current working directory.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the new object.
        isFolder - flag to create a isFolder or a file.
        Throws:
        FileSystemException

      • mount

        void mount(java.lang.String name,
           java.lang.String remoteIP,
           int remotePort,
           java.lang.String user,
           java.lang.String pass)
    throws FileSystemException
        Mounts a RemoteFolder into our file system.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the new remote folder
        remoteIP - IP-Address of the remote file system
        remotePort - Port of the remote file system
        user - username
        pass - password
        Throws:
        FileSystemException
